content.raw:
The AWS machines are in EDT timezone.

The competitors asked for the cloudsim upgrade late last week. Upon approval, we spent the weekend implementing and testing. Deployment occurred on Tuesday.

There is a lot of confusion surrounding the upgrade, and the ability to run simulations. So, here is some clarifications:

1. Tunnel circuit submissions started Monday evening, following the cloudsim upgrade.
2. Tunnel circuit submissions consume large amounts of AWS resources.
3. The simulation queue is first-com-first served.
4. If you experienced delays in your submissions, then it was because of load (i.e. lack of AWS resources) and *NOT* because of the upgrade. Correlation is not causation.
content.html:
The AWS machines are in EDT timezone.

The competitors asked for the cloudsim upgrade late last week. Upon approval, we spent the weekend implementing and testing. Deployment occurred on Tuesday.

There is a lot of confusion surrounding the upgrade, and the ability to run simulations. So, here is some clarifications:

  1. Tunnel circuit submissions started Monday evening, following the cloudsim upgrade.
  2. Tunnel circuit submissions consume large amounts of AWS resources.
  3. The simulation queue is first-com-first served.
  4. If you experienced delays in your submissions, then it was because of load (i.e. lack of AWS resources) and NOT because of the upgrade. Correlation is not causation.
